column4: i was wondering if anyone can offer some assistance to me, im completely green with anything linux and was in the process of downloading and installing linux on to a laptop and after booting up with the disk i got an error (initramfs) mount: mounting /dev/loop0 on //filesystem.squashfs failed Input/output error can not mount /dev/loop0 (/cdrom/casper/filesystem.squashfs) on //filrsystem.squashfs --- anyone know why this error me
you are trying to run the live cd ?
yeah i downloaded it off the ubuntu website and burned the image to a disk
ok when you insert and boot from the cd  is there a point you see a small "keyboard" image at the bottom of the screen?
when you see that... hit enter  and a menu should appear   with several options you should run... the first is    check file integrity  or  check cd for errors
if you do get errors from the cd check... you will have to re download  the iso image   and burn it at 1x  if possible  eliminating most of the possible  burn issues at higher speeds
you can download and burn the minimal install cd
this pulls all files from the server as it installs  eliminating download errors..however it is NOT  alive cd
if you just want to test it then the livd cd is the way to go...if you want to actually install it then I would go with the minimal install
it is not  "minimal"  in that you dont get everything...it is minimal because it is only a  meg  iso
let me get the link hold on
one thing to keep in mind when you start this... at one point you will get a list of things to install...you scroll the list with the arrow buttons and choose one  with the "Spacebar"  not enter
I would go with the regular  ubuntu-desktop
no problem...by the way... I only use the minimal install cd  here
